title: Instructional Design for Creating Slowmation Animations to Understand Cell Division Concepts

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Life Science Knowledge, Understanding of Cell Structure, and Teaching Experience
context.additional_context: A training program for pre-service teachers aimed at cultivating the ability to apply instructional methods to actual middle and high school classrooms

learning_goals: Learners can represent the step-by-step process of cell division using Slowmation animation.
Learners can collaboratively create concept explanation materials and provide peer feedback.
Learners can analyze misconceptions discovered during the animation production process and propose corrective measures.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
